clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Biomarker IL-6 in Synovial Fluid in Obese and Normal Weight Patients Suffering From Gonarthrosis During Knee Arthroplasty Surgery.
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Biomarker IL-6 in Synovial Fluid in Obese and Normal Weight Patients Suffering From Gonarthrosis During Knee Arthroplasty Surgery.

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate the concentration of IL-6 in the synovial fluid of obese patients suffering from gonarthrosis during knee arthroplasty surgery

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate whether the IL-6 concentration in the synovial fluid of obese patients is 100% higher than the IL-6 concentration of the synovial fluid in normal weight patients

clinical_study.condition: IL-6 Concentration in the Synovial Fluid of Obese Patients is 100% Higher Than the IL-6 Concentration of the Synovial Fluid in Normal Weight Patients

arm_group.arm_group_label: 20 normal weight patients with BMI between 18.5 - 24.9 inclusive

intervention.intervention_name: Evaluation of IL-6 biomarkers in synovial fluid
intervention.description: Evaluation of IL-6 biomarkers in synovial fluid in obese and normal weight patients with gonarthrosis
intervention.arm_group_label: 20 normal weight patients with BMI between 18.5 - 24.9 inclusive

study_pop.textblock: The population is made up of obese and normal weight patients, of age, undergoing knee replacement surgery for gonarthrosis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
age between 55 and 85 years inclusive, Normal weight patients with BMI 18-24.9 included Obese patients with BMI ≥ 30 Patients with gonarthrosis awaiting knee replacement surgery Patients awaiting knee replacement surgery Patients who agree to sign informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
Patients less than 55 years of age. Patients over 85 years of age Patients with diabetes mellitus Patients who are unable to understand and want Patients with severe neurological disorders or with severe disabilities Rheumatoid arthritis patients Cancer patients Patients on immunosuppressive therapy
